subject: Languages
title: The Rosetta Stone: Key to Egypt's Secrets
description: Learn The Rosetta Stone: Key to Egypt's Secrets in one minute.

hook.text: A slab of black stone found by Napoleon's soldiers unlocked 3,000 years of Egyptian civilization.

buildup.text: The Rosetta Stone carries the same text in three scripts: hieroglyphs, demotic, and ancient Greek.

discovery.text: Jean-FranÃ§ois Champollion used the Greek as a key to crack the hieroglyphs in 1822.

twist.text: Previous scholars assumed hieroglyphs were purely symbolic. Champollion proved they also encoded sounds.

climax.text: His breakthrough opened every temple, tomb, and papyrus in Egypt to modern scholars.

punchline.text: One stone, three scripts, and a young genius gave us back an entire lost civilization.

quiz.question: What made the Rosetta Stone the key to deciphering hieroglyphs?
options: It had the same text in hieroglyphs, demotic, and Greek
It was the oldest Egyptian text ever found
It was written by a pharaoh
